In supply chain management, what is the primary purpose of demand forecasting?
A. To predict customer demand and adjust the operations of the supply chain accordingly
B. To determine the price of goods or services
C. To identify potential suppliers in the market
D. To manage the transportation of goods

The primary purpose of demand forecasting in supply chain management is to predict customer demand and adjust the operations of the supply chain accordingly. This helps companies to optimize their inventory levels, production schedules, and distribution networks to meet customer needs efficiently and effectively. By accurately forecasting demand, companies can reduce costs, improve customer satisfaction, and gain a competitive advantage in the market.
